hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Breakout on 3-Day Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a ±5% range for 10 consecutive days (neutral regime), a breakout above the range high with 3-day volume exceeding 150% of the 20-day average will signal a transition to a bull regime, with the move sustaining for at least 7 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended consolidation in neutral regimes often precedes directional moves. Volume confirmation reduces false breakouts. The 7-day sustainability filter avoids whipsaws while capturing early regime transition momentum.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day price range ≤ 10% (high-low relative to mean)
BTC closes > upper 5% boundary of consolidation range
ETH/BTC ratio shows stability or slight uptrend (≤ 2% daily decline)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7-day hold period complete OR price reaches +12% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price re-enters consolidation range (closes below upper 2.5% boundary)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such signals fail to sustain beyond 3 days OR result in immediate range reversion within 48 hours.
